alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Douglas; Gwinnett; North Fulton; Paulding; Rockdale; South Fulton; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Paulding, central Rockdale, DeKalb, Cobb, northeastern Douglas, southwestern Gwinnett, west central Walton and central Fulton Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 646 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near New Georgia to Clarkston, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Marietta, Douglasville, Decatur, Conyers, Dallas, City of South Fulton, Sandy Springs, Smyrna, Dunwoody, East Point, Kennesaw, Snellville, Powder Springs, Lilburn, Loganville, Chamblee, Doraville, Clarkston and Austell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: DeKalb; Douglas; Gwinnett; North Fulton; Paulding; Rockdale; South Fulton; Walton
